jordan.szalontai.unicrush

Class LevelBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • jordan.szalontai.unicrush.LevelBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StandardLevelBuilder

    public abstract class LevelBuilder
extends Object
    Abstract class for building instances of Level. This class follows the builder pattern.
    Author:
    Szalontai Jord√°n

      The Level instance we build.

      LevelBuilder()
      Constructs an empty instance.

      Constructor to set the level field of the class, so we don't start from the beginnings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelBuilder

        public LevelBuilder()
        Constructs an empty instance.

      • LevelBuilder

        public LevelBuilder(Level level)
        Constructor to set the level field of the class, so we don't start from the beginnings.
        Parameters:
        level - the level that we would like to continue building

    • Method Detail

      • setBoardSize

        public LevelBuilder setBoardSize(int size)
                          throws Exception
        Sets the boardSize filed of the level we are building.
        Parameters:
        size - the new size for the level we are building
        Returns:
        this so we can chain the methods after each other
        Throws:
        Exception - the new size must be at least two

      • setAvailableSteps

        public LevelBuilder setAvailableSteps(int steps)
                               throws Exception
        Sets the availableSteps filed of the level we are building.
        Parameters:
        steps - the new amount of steps for the level we are building
        Returns:
        this so we can chain the methods after each other
        Throws:
        Exception - the amount of steps cannot be negative or zero

      • setCompliteScore

        public LevelBuilder setCompliteScore(int score)
                              throws Exception
        Sets the availableSteps filed of the level we are building.
        Parameters:
        score - the score required to complete the level we are building
        Returns:
        this so we can chain the methods after each other
        Throws:
        Exception - the score required to complete a level cannot be negative or zero

      • putWallsFromString

        public LevelBuilder putWallsFromString(String template)
        Sets elements of a Level's board to null based on a template String.
        Parameters:
        template - a string representing the coordinates needed to be replaced in the following form: "i1,j1;i2,j2; ... ;in,jn"
        Returns:
        this so we can chain the methods after each other

      • setBoardFromState

        public LevelBuilder setBoardFromState(String boardState)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the elements of a Level's board as described in the given String
        Parameters:
        boardState - a string representing a Level' board.
        Returns:
        this so we can chain the methods after each other
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the boardSize, or the walls field is not set
        See Also:
        Level.getBoardState()

      • fillBoard

        public abstract LevelBuilder fillBoard()
                                throws Exception
        An abstract method for filling up the specific instances as desired.
        Returns:
        this, so we can chain the methods after each other
        Throws:
        Exception - if something unexpected happens, e.g. the walls are not set

      • create

        public Level create()
        Gives back the level we were building. This is a terminal step, so we cannot chain methods anymore after this.
        Returns:
        the level instance of this builder

      • processCoordinateString

        public static Integer[][] processCoordinateString(String walls)
        Creates a 2D-array that has coordinates that indicate locations on a board.
        Parameters:
        walls - A String with the pattern. An example String: "0,0;0,1;0,2".
        Returns:
        the 2D-array containing the coordinates
